title: AI and Math at Queen's Computing
summary: I am a computing student focused on using artificial intelligence to solve high-value problems. Through experience in machine learning, data science, and software development, I aim to create exciting and deeply impactful projects.

studies.title: Bachelor of Computing, Focus in AI, Minor in Math

certifications.title: Applied Plotting, Charting & Data Representation in Python by University of Michigan
Introduction to Data Science by University of Michigan

awards.description: Awarded on the recommendation of the Awards Committee of the Faculty of Arts and Science to students with high academic standing.

awards.awardName: Dean's Honour List with Distinction - Second Year
awards.description: Awarded to the top 3% of students in Queen's Science or Computing by cumulative GPA.

awards.awardName: Dean's Honour List with Distinction - First Year
awards.description: Awarded to the top 3% of students in Queen's Science or Computing by cumulative GPA.
Awarded on the basis of academic excellence to students entering second, third, or fourth year in the Faculty of Arts and Science.
Awarded to the top 2 highest results in first year exams in Queen's Arts and Science.

awards.awardName: George Thomas Warren Scholarship in Computing Science
awards.description: Awarded to second year student(s) with the top GPA in the Queen's School of Computing.
Entrance scholarship for Queen's University for a high school average greater than 95%.
Highest four year average at a Canadian high school (99%).
In a competition of the best programmers in the greater Kingston area, I led my team to win the competition.

awards.awardName: 6th Place Eastern Regional ECOO Programming Contest
awards.description: Competing with the best programmers in a third of Ontario I lead my team to win 6th place, and advance to provincials.

awards.awardName: Duke of Edinburgh Gold Level Award
awards.description: I earned "The world's leading youth achievement award", through dedication to computer science, martial arts, tutoring, kayacking in Georgian Bay, and completing SHAD 2017.
Completed SHAD Waterloo 2017, Canada's premier STEM enrichment program for exceptional students.

roles.title: Data Scientist Intern
roles.description: Do lotsa research and stuf and stuff and stufff and I'll replace this.
bullets: Developed a Python based automated client data ingress pipeline, improving consultant time efficiency by 1.5 full time employee equivalents, facilitating a strategic account scaling by 3x in value.
Visualized and prototyped a volume alerting toolkit with Pandas that was deployed on 5 gas plants for consultants to rapidly identify irregular flows.
Developed a scalable and model-agnostic object-oriented toolkit to forecast the quality of oil and gas, improving mid-month gas plant balance accuracy.

experiences.companyName: The Perk Lab, Queen's School of Computing

roles.title: Undergraduate Researcher
roles.description: Do lotsa research and stuf and stuff and stufff and I'll replace this.
bullets: Automatically annotated surgical video with 98% accuracy using convolutional neural networks in Keras at 30fps, on the open source 3D Slicer platform. Accepted for publication in SPIE 2020.

Extended 3D Slicer platform to analyze the curves of patients' colons in CT scans for a local physician, resulting in publications to SPIE 2019 and CARS 2019. The local physician is using this work in clinical study.
Mentored a high school intern to implement a 3D U-Net for semantic segmentation of CT scans with 98.8% dice accuracy using Keras and Jupyter notebooks. Accepted for publication in SPIE 2020.
Developed an augmented reality surgery training tool with Microsoft HoloLens to visualize hernia surgery in 3D.
Presented at SPIE 2019 in San Diego, Inquiry at Queen's 2019, CSearch 2019, and the Imaging Network of Ontario 2019.

roles.title: Outreach Manager
roles.description: Managing the Perk Lab's outreach presence and coordinating with academic, government and industry visitors.

roles.title: Director of Research
roles.description: I am leading a team of five to develop a robotic computer vision system to map images to path traversability with K-Means clustering on IMU data, and neural networks on image data through ROS (Robot Operating System).

roles.title: AI Team Lead
roles.description: I am leading a team of five to develop a robotic computer vision system to map images to path traversability with K-Means clustering on IMU data, and neural networks on image data through ROS (Robot Operating System).

roles.title: AI Engineer
roles.description: Predicted house valuations within 20% using a CNN on Google Street View and satellite images, and a multi-layer perceptron on point of interest data. Utilized APIs on the Google Cloud for address lookup and image retrieval.

roles.title: Web Developer
roles.description: Working in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.Js, React Js, and MongoDB.

roles.title: Software Team Engineer
roles.description: Developement towards a low cost electrochemical impedance spectroscopy unit for detection of skin diseases.

bullets: I am leading a team of five to develop a robotic computer vision system to map images to path traversability with K-Means clustering on IMU data, and neural networks on image data through ROS (Robot Operating System).
Predicted house valuations within 20% using a CNN on Google Street View and satellite images, and a multi-layer perceptron on point of interest data.
Utilized APIs on the Google Cloud for address lookup and image retrieval.
My team of four partnered with Co-Operators and presented at the Canadian Undergraduate Conference on AI 2019.
Hides messages in images by modifying RGB values with the Python Image Library. Socket programming is used for wireless communication, and TkInter is used for the graphical user interface.
We developed a Chrome web extension in JavaScript to blur spoilers on web pages, using keywords I webscraped from movie databases with custom Standard Library APIs I wrote in Python.
Developed a Java application to parse the Human Phenotype Ontology, creating a tree structure which is recursively traversed to explore phenotypes.
Automatically annotated surgical video with 98% accuracy using convolutional neural networks in Keras at 30fps, on the open source 3D Slicer platform.

research.paperTitle: Open source platform for automated collection of training data to support video-based feedback in surgical simulators
research.citation: Jacob Laframboise, Tamas Ungi, et al. "Open source platform for automated collection of training data to support video-based feedback in surgical simulators".

research.paperTitle: Analyzing the curvature of the colon in different patient positions
research.citation: Jacob Laframboise, Tamas Ungi, Andras Lasso, Mark Asselin, Matthew S. Holden, Pearl Tan, Lawrence Hookey, and Gabor Fichtinger "Analyzing the curvature of the colon in different patient positions", Proc. SPIE 10951, Medical Imaging 2019: Image-Guided Procedures, Robotic Interventions, and Modeling, 109512F (8 March 2019); https://doi.org/10.1117/12.2512455
